question: 文字
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>writing</kanji> <kanji>letter</kanji> is simpler than it sounds. It's really just a <vocabulary>letter</vocabulary>, right? You're reading <ja>文字</ja> right now, in fact!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. The reading of <ja>文</ja> is a bit of an exception here, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember this:

You know all the <vocabulary>letters of the alphabet</vocabulary> only because of <reading>Moe</reading> (<ja>も</ja>). If it wasn't for your buddy Moe teaching you all the letters, you probably wouldn't even be able to read today. Thanks Moe!
